issues.title: Missing Required Notification Elements for Initial Truancy
issues.description: Education Code 48260.5 requires specific notification elements that must be provided to parents/guardians when a student is first identified as truant. The AR includes most required elements but is missing two mandatory components: notification that parents may be guilty of an infraction and subject to prosecution, and information about the parent's right to request a meeting with school personnel.

legal_citations.text: Upon a pupil's initial classification as a truant, the school district shall notify the pupil's parent or guardian, by the most cost-effective method possible, which may include electronic mail or a telephone call, that: (1) The pupil is truant. (2) The parent or guardian is obligated to compel the attendance of the pupil at school. (3) Parents or guardians who fail to compel the attendance of the pupil at school may be guilty of an infraction and subject to prosecution pursuant to Article 6 (commencing with Section 48290). (4) Alternative educational programs are available in the district. (5) The parent or guardian has the right to meet with appropriate school personnel to discuss solutions to the pupil's truancy. (6) The pupil may be subject to prosecution under Section 48264. (7) The pupil may be subject to suspension, restriction, or delay of the pupil's driving privilege pursuant to Section 13202.7 of the Vehicle Code. (8) It is recommended that the parent or guardian accompany the pupil to school and attend classes with the pupil for one day.

issues.required_language: Add to AR section 1.b: "iii. Parents/guardians who fail to compel the attendance of the pupil at school may be guilty of an infraction and subject to prosecution pursuant to Education Code 48290 et seq." and "viii. The parent/guardian has the right to request a meeting with appropriate school personnel to discuss solutions to the student's truancy" and "ix. The student may be subject to prosecution under Education Code 48264" and "x. The student may be subject to suspension, restriction, or delay of driving privileges pursuant to Vehicle Code 13202.7" and "xi. It is recommended that the parent/guardian accompany the student to school and attend classes with the student for one day."

issues.title: Missing School Attendance Review Board (SARB) Establishment Authority
issues.description: California law requires districts to either establish their own SARB or participate in a joint SARB. The policy and regulation reference SARB programs but do not establish the district's authority to create or participate in SARB, which is a fundamental requirement for truancy intervention.

legal_citations.text: The governing board of any school district may establish a school attendance review board or may contract with the county superintendent of schools, the probation department, or other school districts to establish a school attendance review board.

issues.required_language: The Board may establish a school attendance review board (SARB) or may contract with the county superintendent of schools, probation department, or other school districts to establish a joint SARB to address chronic absence and truancy issues in accordance with Education Code 48320 et seq.

issues.title: Incomplete Board Policy Content
issues.description: The Board Policy content appears to be cut off mid-sentence at the end, suggesting the policy is incomplete. The final sentence begins "As appropriate, the Superintendent or" but does not finish, indicating missing content that may contain additional required elements.

legal_citations.text: Various sections require comprehensive policy coverage of compulsory attendance requirements and procedures.

issues.required_language: The incomplete sentence and any missing policy content must be completed to ensure full compliance with state requirements.

issues.title: Missing Reference to Driving Privilege Consequences
issues.description: While the AR mentions driving privilege consequences in the required notifications, neither the BP nor AR clearly establishes the district's role in reporting truancy to the Department of Motor Vehicles for driving privilege restrictions as required by Vehicle Code 13202.7.

legal_citations.text: Requires school districts to report habitual truants to DMV for driving privilege restrictions.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall report habitual truants to the Department of Motor Vehicles for driving privilege restrictions in accordance with Vehicle Code 13202.7.
